intro: Phlegmariurus dichotomus, commonly known as the dichotomous liverwort, is a non-vascular plant belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a leafy liverwort that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky crevices. The plant has a distinctive branching pattern, with stems that split into two equal parts, giving it its scientific name. Its leaves are closely appressed to the stem and often have a waxy coating to reduce water loss. This species plays an important role in nutrient cycling in its ecosystem due to its ability to absorb and retain moisture.
